short_description: Indulge in the rich history, delicious cuisine, and stunning natural beauty of Turkey, where a blend of European and Middle Eastern cultures meet. Explore the ancient ruins of Ephesus, indulge in the culinary delights of Istanbul's Grand Bazaar, or relax on the beaches of Antalya

tipping.hotels: Is it customary to tip hotel staff, including 4-5 Lira per bag to porters, 15 Lira to the concierge and 5-10 Lira per day to housekeeping
tipping.guides: Tour guides don't work for tips but you can show appreciation with 10-15 Turkish Lirah
tipping.restaurants: Aim to tip 5-10% in cash, depending on the level of service
tipping.taxis: In Turkey it is not customary or expected to tip taxi drivers. You can round up the fare if you wish

weather.title: Turkey has a varied climate due to its diverse topography. Coastal regions have a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. Inland areas experience more continental climates, with hot summers and cold winters

when_to_visit.title: Sightseeing
when_to_visit.time_period: Spring (March to May), Autumn (September to November)
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild temperatures, comfortable weather conditions, and less rainfall. Great time to visit popular destinations such as Istanbul, Cappadocia, and the Aegean and Mediterranean coastal regions

when_to_visit.title: Best for beaches
when_to_visit.short_description: Peak summer season offers warmer temperatures and crowds in popular beach destinations

when_to_visit.title: Winter
when_to_visit.short_description: Milder temperatures, getting cooler the more inland you travel. Pleasant time to visit Istanbul and Cappadocia

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Turkey depends on the region and activities you plan to engage in, but generally, the months of April to June and September to October offer pleasant temperatures, fewer crowds, and ideal conditions for exploring historical sites and coastal areas
